TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Stapling extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether, and where, a printer staples a multi-page document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the values of this type primarily for these purposes:
- As members of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities.StaplingCapability%2A> collection, which is a property of <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities>, these values indicate the types of stapling that a printer supports.
- As the value of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket.Stapling%2A> property of a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket>, the value instructs the printer whether, and where, to staple.
The `Unknown` value is never used in properties of <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities> objects.
You should never set a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> property to `Unknown`. If some other <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> producing application has created a *PrintTicket document* that sets the stapling feature to an unrecognized option (that is, an option that is not defined in the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397)), then a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> object in your application that is constructed with that document will have `Unknown` as the value of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket.Stapling%2A> property.
Although the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> and <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities> classes cannot be inherited, you can extend the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397) to recognize print device features that are not accounted for in the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities> classes. For more information see [NOTINBUILD: How to: Extend the Print Schema and Create New Print System Classes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/a3600218-1ea5-478a-9853-6560464f2885).
## Examples The following example shows how to test a printer's capabilities and configure the print job to take advantage of them.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#printercapabilities)] [!code-cpp[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/xpscreate/XpsCreate.cpp#printercapabilities)] [!code-vb[XpsCreate#PrinterCapabilities](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpscreate/xpscreate.vb#printercapabilities)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling None = int32(10)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling SaddleStitch = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Multiple staples along the fold line. Also called saddle-stitch stapling.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling StapleBottomLeft = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A single staple in the lower-left corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling StapleBottomRight = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A single staple in the lower-right corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling StapleDualBottom = int32(7)

Docs.summary: Two staples along the lower edge.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling StapleDualLeft = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Two staples along the left edge.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling StapleDualRight = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Two staples along the right edge.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling StapleDualTop = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Two staples along the upper edge.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling StapleTopLeft = int32(8)

Docs.summary: A single staple in the upper-left corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling StapleTopRight = int32(9)

Docs.summary: A single staple in the upper-right corner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.Stapling Unknown = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The feature (whose options are represented by this enumeration) is set to an option not defined in the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397).
